You need to register online at www.umak.edu.oh/olca/registration/new (for freshmen) or https://umak.edu.ph/olca/registration/new/transferee (for transferees) and fill out the application form.
After answering the CAPTCHA, Press submit the application form.
A verification email will be sent to the registered email of the applicant. Open the email address registered in the application form and check for verification email. Click "verify" button.
Another email will be sent containing a pre-filled application form, list of requirements, and the google link where admission requirements will be uploaded.
Submit the complete and clear scanned requirements, compiled in one pdf, in the Google link. Read carefully and follow the instructions in the link
1.Accomplished Application form
2.Four (4) copies of recent 2x2ID pictures (with name tag and white background)
3.Photocopy of Record Card/Transcript of Records
1.Grade 11 Report card (For current Grade 12 Students)
2.Grade 12 Report card (for SHS graduates)
3.Transcript of Record (for college transferees who have completed at least 2 years of tertiary education
4.Photocopy of PSA Birth Certificate
5.Photocopy of Voter's ID/Certificate of Biological parent/or sibling, if applicant is below 18 years old.
4.The examination permit will be sent to the registered email of the applicant. The schedule, venue, and other instructions regarding the admission test are indicated in the examination permit.
Pay the College Qualifying Examination Fee and secure receipt at the Cash Office at G/F Administrative Building or UMak Employees Multi-Purpose Cooperative at G/F Academic Building III. Take the College Qualifying Examination (CQE) on the given schedule.
Wait for the posting of the list of students for screening by the respective Colleges (2nd Phase) in the official UMak Facebook.
An e-mail will be sent by the College regarding the schedule of screening and the results thereafter.
The Notice of Admission (NOA) will be sent through the registered email by the Center for Admission and Scholarship (CAS) after passing the College screening.
Read carefully and follow the instructions in the NOA for online Enrollment/Registration.
